extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.cloudwatch.PutCloudWatchMetric
extension.description: Publishes metrics to Amazon CloudWatch. Metric can be either a single value, or a StatisticSet comprised of minimum, maximum, sum and sample count.

property.name: Namespace
property.description: The namespace for the metric data for CloudWatch

property.name: MetricName
property.description: The name of the metric

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: Value
property.description: The value for the metric. Must be a double

property.name: maximum
property.description: The maximum value of the sample set. Must be a double

property.name: minimum
property.description: The minimum value of the sample set. Must be a double

property.name: sampleCount
property.description: The number of samples used for the statistic set. Must be a double

property.name: sum
property.description: The sum of values for the sample set. Must be a double

property.name: Timestamp
property.description: A point in time expressed as the number of milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC. If not specified, the default value is set to the time the metric data was received

property.name: Unit
property.description: The unit of the metric. (e.g Seconds, Bytes, Megabytes, Percent, Count, Kilobytes/Second, Terabits/Second, Count/Second) For details see http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_MetricDatum.html

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

dynamicProperty.name: Dimension Name
dynamicProperty.description: Allows dimension name/value pairs to be added to the metric. AWS supports a maximum of 10 dimensions.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.dynamodb.PutDynamoDBRecord
extension.description: Inserts items into DynamoDB based on record-oriented data. The record fields are mapped into DynamoDB item fields, including partition and sort keys if set. Depending on the number of records the processor might execute the insert in multiple chunks in order to overcome DynamoDB's limitation on batch writing. This might result partially processed FlowFiles in which case the FlowFile will be transferred to the "unprocessed" relationship with the necessary attribute to retry later without duplicating the already executed inserts.

property.name: Table Name
property.description: The DynamoDB table name

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for parsing incoming data and determining the data's schema.

property.name: partition-key-strategy
property.description: Defines the strategy the processor uses to assign partition key value to the inserted Items.

allowableValue.description: Uses the value of the Record field identified by the "Partition Key Field" property as partition key value.

Uses an incoming FlowFile attribute identified by "Partition Key Attribute" as the value of the partition key. The incoming Records must not contain field with the same name defined by the "Partition Key Field".
Uses a generated UUID as value for the partition key. The incoming Records must not contain field with the same name defined by the "Partition Key Field".

property.name: partition-key-field
property.description: Defines the name of the partition key field in the DynamoDB table. Partition key is also known as hash key. Depending on the "Partition Key Strategy" the field value might come from the incoming Record or a generated one.

property.name: partition-key-attribute
property.description: Specifies the FlowFile attribute that will be used as the value of the partition key when using "Partition by attribute" partition key strategy.

property.name: sort-key-strategy
property.description: Defines the strategy the processor uses to assign sort key to the inserted Items.

allowableValue.description: The processor will not assign sort key to the inserted Items.
Uses the value of the Record field identified by the "Sort Key Field" property as sort key value.
The processor will assign a number for every item based on the original record's position in the incoming FlowFile. This will be used as sort key value.

property.name: sort-key-field
property.description: Defines the name of the sort key field in the DynamoDB table. Sort key is also known as range key.

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to unprocessed relationship when DynamoDB is not able to process all the items in the request. Typical reasons are insufficient table throughput capacity and exceeding the maximum bytes per request. Unprocessed FlowFiles can be retried with a new request.

readsAttribute.description: Number of chunks successfully inserted into DynamoDB. If not set, it is considered as 0

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.kinesis.stream.ConsumeKinesisStream
extension.description: Reads data from the specified AWS Kinesis stream and outputs a FlowFile for every processed Record (raw) or a FlowFile for a batch of processed records if a Record Reader and Record Writer are configured. At-least-once delivery of all Kinesis Records within the Stream while the processor is running. AWS Kinesis Client Library can take several seconds to initialise before starting to fetch data. Uses DynamoDB for check pointing and CloudWatch (optional) for metrics. Ensure that the credentials provided have access to DynamoDB and CloudWatch (optional) along with Kinesis.

property.name: Amazon Kinesis Stream Name
property.description: The name of Kinesis Stream

property.name: Application Name
property.description: The Kinesis stream reader application name.

property.name: Record Reader
property.description: The Record Reader to use for reading received messages. The Kinesis Stream name can be referred to by Expression Language '${kinesis.name}' to access a schema. If Record Reader/Writer are not specified, each Kinesis Record will create a FlowFile.

property.name: Record Writer
property.description: The Record Writer to use for serializing Records to an output FlowFile. The Kinesis Stream name can be referred to by Expression Language '${kinesis.name}' to access a schema. If Record Reader/Writer are not specified, each Kinesis Record will create a FlowFile.

property.name: Output Strategy
property.description: The format used to output the Kinesis Record into a FlowFile Record.

allowableValue.description: Write only the Kinesis Record value to the FlowFile record.
Write the Kinesis Record value and metadata into the FlowFile record.

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: DynamoDB Override
property.description: DynamoDB override to use non-AWS deployments

property.name: Initial Stream Position
property.description: Initial position to read Kinesis streams.

allowableValue.description: Start reading just after the most recent record in the shard, so that you always read the most recent data in the shard.
Start reading at the last untrimmed record in the shard in the system, which is the oldest data record in the shard.
Start reading from the position denoted by a specific time stamp, provided in the value Timestamp.

property.name: Stream Position Timestamp
property.description: Timestamp position in stream from which to start reading Kinesis Records. Required if Initial position to read Kinesis streams. is AT_TIMESTAMP. Uses the Timestamp Format to parse value into a Date.

property.name: Timestamp Format
property.description: Format to use for parsing the Stream Position Timestamp into a Date and converting the Kinesis Record's Approximate Arrival Timestamp into a FlowFile attribute.

property.name: Failover Timeout
property.description: Kinesis Client Library failover timeout

property.name: Graceful Shutdown Timeout
property.description: Kinesis Client Library graceful shutdown timeout

property.name: Checkpoint Interval
property.description: Interval between Kinesis checkpoints

property.name: Retry Count
property.description: Number of times to retry a Kinesis operation (process record, checkpoint, shutdown)

property.name: Retry Wait
property.description: Interval between Kinesis operation retries (process record, checkpoint, shutdown)

property.name: Report Metrics to CloudWatch
property.description: Whether to report Kinesis usage metrics to CloudWatch.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

dynamicProperty.name: Kinesis Client Library (KCL) Configuration property name
dynamicProperty.value: Value to set in the KCL Configuration property
dynamicProperty.description: Override default KCL Configuration ConfigsBuilder properties with required values. Supports setting of values directly on the ConfigsBuilder, such as 'namespace', as well as properties on nested builders. For example, to set configsBuilder.retrievalConfig().maxListShardsRetryAttempts(value), name the property as 'retrievalConfig.maxListShardsRetryAttempts'. Only supports setting of simple property values, e.g. String, int, long and boolean. Does not allow override of KCL Configuration settings handled by non-dynamic processor properties.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.partition.key
writesAttribute.description: Partition key of the (last) Kinesis Record read from the Shard

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.shard.id
writesAttribute.description: Shard ID from which the Kinesis Record was read

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.sequence.number
writesAttribute.description: The unique identifier of the (last) Kinesis Record within its Shard

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.approximate.arrival.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: Approximate arrival timestamp of the (last) Kinesis Record read from the stream

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Sets the mime.type attribute to the MIME Type specified by the Record Writer (if configured)

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: Number of records written to the FlowFiles by the Record Writer (if configured)

writesAttribute.name: record.error.message
writesAttribute.description: This attribute provides on failure the error message encountered by the Record Reader or Record Writer (if configured)

systemResourceConsideration.description: Kinesis Client Library is used to create a Worker thread for consumption of Kinesis Records. The Worker is initialised and started when this Processor has been triggered. It runs continually, spawning Kinesis Record Processors as required to fetch Kinesis Records. The Worker Thread (and any child Record Processor threads) are not controlled by the normal NiFi scheduler as part of the Concurrent Thread pool and are not released until this processor is stopped.
Kinesis Client Library will continually poll for new Records, requesting up to a maximum number of Records/bytes per call. This can result in sustained network usage.

useCase.description: Fetch a specific file from S3
useCase.configuration:
The "Bucket" property should be set to the name of the S3 bucket that contains the file. Typically this is defined as an attribute on an incoming FlowFile, so this property is set to `${s3.bucket}`. The "Object Key" property denotes the fully qualified filename of the file to fetch. Typically, the FlowFile's `filename` attribute is used, so this property is set to `${filename}`. The "Region" property must be set to denote the S3 region that the Bucket resides in. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{S3_REGION}`.
The "AWS Credentials Provider service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService in order to provide credentials for accessing the file.

multiProcessorUseCase.description: Retrieve all files in an S3 bucket

processorConfiguration.configuration:
The "Bucket" property should be set to the name of the S3 bucket that files reside in. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{S3_SOURCE_BUCKET}`. The "Region" property must be set to denote the S3 region that the Bucket resides in. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{S3_SOURCE_REGION}`.
The "AWS Credentials Provider service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService in order to provide credentials for accessing the bucket.
The 'success' Relationship of this Processor is then connected to FetchS3Object.

"Bucket" = "${s3.bucket}" "Object Key" = "${filename}"
The "AWS Credentials Provider service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService in order to provide credentials for accessing the bucket.
The "Region" property must be set to the same value as the "Region" property of the ListS3 Processor.

multiProcessorUseCase.description: Retrieve only files from S3 that meet some specified criteria

processorConfiguration.configuration:
The "Bucket" property should be set to the name of the S3 bucket that files reside in. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{S3_SOURCE_BUCKET}`. The "Region" property must be set to denote the S3 region that the Bucket resides in. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{S3_SOURCE_REGION}`.
The "AWS Credentials Provider service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService in order to provide credentials for accessing the bucket.
The 'success' Relationship of this Processor is then connected to RouteOnAttribute.

If you would like to "OR" together all of the conditions (i.e., the file should be retrieved if any of the conditions are met), set "Routing Strategy" to "Route to 'matched' if any matches". If you would like to "AND" together all of the conditions (i.e., the file should only be retrieved if all of the conditions are met), set "Routing Strategy" to "Route to 'matched' if all match".
For each condition that you would like to filter on, add a new property. The name of the property should describe the condition. The value of the property should be an Expression Language expression that returns `true` if the file meets the condition or `false` if the file does not meet the condition.
Some attributes that you may consider filtering on are: - `filename` (the name of the file) - `s3.length` (the number of bytes in the file) - `s3.tag.<tag name>` (the value of the s3 tag with the name `tag name`) - `s3.user.metadata.<key name>` (the value of the user metadata with the key named `key name`)
For example, to fetch only files that are at least 1 MB and have a filename ending in `.zip` we would set the following properties: - "Routing Strategy" = "Route to 'matched' if all match" - "At least 1 MB" = "${s3.length:ge(1000000)}" - "Ends in .zip" = "${filename:endsWith('.zip')}"
Auto-terminate the `unmatched` Relationship. Connect the `matched` Relationship to the FetchS3Object processor.

"Bucket" = "${s3.bucket}" "Object Key" = "${filename}"
The "AWS Credentials Provider service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService in order to provide credentials for accessing the bucket.
The "Region" property must be set to the same value as the "Region" property of the ListS3 Processor.

multiProcessorUseCase.description: Retrieve new files as they arrive in an S3 bucket
multiProcessorUseCase.notes: This method of retrieving files from S3 is more efficient than using ListS3 and more cost effective. It is the pattern recommended by AWS. However, it does require that the S3 bucket be configured to place notifications on an SQS queue when new files arrive. For more information, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/ways-to-add-notification-config-to-bucket.html

processorConfiguration.configuration:
The "Queue URL" must be set to the appropriate URL for the SQS queue. It is recommended that this property be parameterized, using a value such as `#{SQS_QUEUE_URL}`. The "Region" property must be set to denote the SQS region that the queue resides in. It's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{SQS_REGION}`.
The "AWS Credentials Provider service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService in order to provide credentials for accessing the bucket.
The 'success' relationship is connected to EvaluateJsonPath.

"Destination" = "flowfile-attribute" "s3.bucket" = "$.Records[0].s3.bucket.name" "filename" = "$.Records[0].s3.object.key"
The 'success' relationship is connected to FetchS3Object.

"Bucket" = "${s3.bucket}" "Object Key" = "${filename}"
The "Region" property must be set to the same value as the "Region" property of the GetSQS Processor. The "AWS Credentials Provider service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService in order to provide credentials for accessing the bucket.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.GetS3ObjectMetadata
extension.description: Check for the existence of an Object in S3 and fetch its Metadata without attempting to download it. This processor can be used as a router for workflows that need to check on an Object in S3 before proceeding with data processing

property.name: Metadata Target
property.description: This determines where the metadata will be written when found.

allowableValue.description: When selected, the metadata will be written to FlowFile attributes with the prefix "s3." following the convention used in other processors. For example: the standard S3 attribute Content-Type will be written as s3.Content-Type when using the default value. User-defined metadata will be included in the attributes added to the FlowFile
Write the metadata to FlowFile content as JSON data.

property.name: Metadata Attribute Include Pattern
property.description: A regular expression pattern to use for determining which object metadata entries are included as FlowFile attributes. This pattern is only applied to the 'found' relationship and will not be used to filter the error attributes in the 'failure' relationship.

property.name: Bucket
property.description: The S3 Bucket to interact with

property.name: Object Key
property.description: The S3 Object Key to use. This is analogous to a filename for traditional file systems.

property.name: Version
property.description: The Version of the Object for which to retrieve Metadata

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: Region
property.description: The AWS Region to connect to.

property.name: Communications Timeout

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.ListS3
extension.description: Retrieves a listing of objects from an S3 bucket. For each object that is listed, creates a FlowFile that represents the object so that it can be fetched in conjunction with FetchS3Object. This Processor is designed to run on Primary Node only in a cluster. If the primary node changes, the new Primary Node will pick up where the previous node left off without duplicating all of the data.

property.name: Bucket
property.description: The S3 Bucket to interact with

property.name: Region
property.description: The AWS Region to connect to.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: listing-strategy
property.description: Specify how to determine new/updated entities. See each strategy descriptions for detail.

allowableValue.description: This strategy tracks the latest timestamp of listed entity to determine new/updated entities. Since it only tracks few timestamps, it can manage listing state efficiently. This strategy will not pick up any newly added or modified entity if their timestamps are older than the tracked latest timestamp. Also may miss files when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running.

This strategy tracks information of all the listed entities within the latest 'Entity Tracking Time Window' to determine new/updated entities. This strategy can pick entities having old timestamp that can be missed with 'Tracing Timestamps'. Works even when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running. However an additional DistributedMapCache controller service is required and more JVM heap memory is used. For more information on how the 'Entity Tracking Time Window' property works, see the description.

This strategy lists all entities without any tracking. The same entities will be listed each time this processor is scheduled. It is recommended to change the default run schedule value. Any property that relates to the persisting state will be ignored.

property.name: et-state-cache
property.description: Listed entities are stored in the specified cache storage so that this processor can resume listing across NiFi restart or in case of primary node change. 'Tracking Entities' strategy require tracking information of all listed entities within the last 'Tracking Time Window'. To support large number of entities, the strategy uses DistributedMapCache instead of managed state. Cache key format is 'ListedEntities::{processorId}(::{nodeId})'. If it tracks per node listed entities, then the optional '::{nodeId}' part is added to manage state separately. E.g. cluster wide cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b', per node cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b::nifi-node3' The stored cache content is Gzipped JSON string. The cache key will be deleted when target listing configuration is changed. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-time-window
property.description: Specify how long this processor should track already-listed entities. 'Tracking Entities' strategy can pick any entity whose timestamp is inside the specified time window. For example, if set to '30 minutes', any entity having timestamp in recent 30 minutes will be the listing target when this processor runs. A listed entity is considered 'new/updated' and a FlowFile is emitted if one of following condition meets: 1. does not exist in the already-listed entities, 2. has newer timestamp than the cached entity, 3. has different size than the cached entity. If a cached entity's timestamp becomes older than specified time window, that entity will be removed from the cached already-listed entities. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-initial-listing-target
property.description: Specify how initial listing should be handled. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

allowableValue.description: Ignore entities having timestamp older than the specified 'Tracking Time Window' at the initial listing activity.
Regardless of entities timestamp, all existing entities will be listed at the initial listing activity.

property.name: record-writer
property.description: Specifies the Record Writer to use for creating the listing. If not specified, one FlowFile will be created for each entity that is listed. If the Record Writer is specified, all entities will be written to a single FlowFile instead of adding attributes to individual FlowFiles.

property.name: min-age
property.description: The minimum age that an S3 object must be in order to be considered; any object younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: max-age
property.description: The maximum age that an S3 object can be in order to be considered; any object older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: Listing Batch Size
property.description: If not using a Record Writer, this property dictates how many S3 objects should be listed in a single batch. Once this number is reached, the FlowFiles that have been created will be transferred out of the Processor. Setting this value lower may result in lower latency by sending out the FlowFiles before the complete listing has finished. However, it can significantly reduce performance. Larger values may take more memory to store all of the information before sending the FlowFiles out. This property is ignored if using a Record Writer, as one of the main benefits of the Record Writer is being able to emit the entire listing as a single FlowFile.

property.name: write-s3-object-tags
property.description: If set to 'True', the tags associated with the S3 object will be written as FlowFile attributes

property.name: write-s3-user-metadata
property.description: If set to 'True', the user defined metadata associated with the S3 object will be added to FlowFile attributes/records

property.name: Communications Timeout
property.description: The amount of time to wait in order to establish a connection to AWS or receive data from AWS before timing out.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Signer Override
property.description: The AWS S3 library uses Signature Version 4 by default but this property allows you to specify the Version 2 signer to support older S3-compatible services or even to plug in your own custom signer implementation.

property.name: custom-signer-class-name
property.description: Fully qualified class name of the custom signer class. The signer must implement com.amazonaws.auth.Signer interface.

property.name: custom-signer-module-location
property.description: Comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories which contain the custom signer's JAR file and its dependencies (if any).

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: delimiter
property.description: The string used to delimit directories within the bucket. Please consult the AWS documentation for the correct use of this field.

property.name: prefix
property.description: The prefix used to filter the object list. Do not begin with a forward slash '/'. In most cases, it should end with a forward slash '/'.

property.name: use-versions
property.description: Specifies whether to use S3 versions, if applicable. If false, only the latest version of each object will be returned.

property.name: list-type
property.description: Specifies whether to use the original List Objects or the newer List Objects Version 2 endpoint.

property.name: requester-pays
property.description: If true, indicates that the requester consents to pay any charges associated with listing the S3 bucket. This sets the 'x-amz-request-payer' header to 'requester'. Note that this setting is not applicable when 'Use Versions' is 'true'.

allowableValue.description: Indicates that the requester consents to pay any charges associated with listing the S3 bucket.
Does not consent to pay requester charges for listing the S3 bucket.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this Relationship after they have been successfully processed.

writesAttribute.description: The name of the S3 bucket

writesAttribute.description: The region of the S3 bucket

writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.description: The ETag that can be used to see if the file has changed

writesAttribute.description: A boolean indicating if this is the latest version of the object

writesAttribute.description: The last modified time in milliseconds since epoch in UTC time

writesAttribute.name: s3.length
writesAttribute.description: The size of the object in bytes

writesAttribute.name: s3.storeClass
writesAttribute.description: The storage class of the object

writesAttribute.name: s3.version
writesAttribute.description: The version of the object, if applicable

writesAttribute.name: s3.tag.___
writesAttribute.description: If 'Write Object Tags' is set to 'True', the tags associated to the S3 object that is being listed will be written as part of the flowfile attributes

writesAttribute.name: s3.user.metadata.___
writesAttribute.description: If 'Write User Metadata' is set to 'True', the user defined metadata associated to the S3 object that is being listed will be written as part of the flowfile attributes

stateful.description: After performing a listing of keys, the timestamp of the newest key is stored, along with the keys that share that same timestamp. This allows the Processor to list only keys that have been added or modified after this date the next time that the Processor is run. State is stored across the cluster so that this Processor can be run on Primary Node only and if a new Primary Node is selected, the new node can pick up where the previous node left off, without duplicating the data.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.PutS3Object
extension.description: Writes the contents of a FlowFile as an S3 Object to an Amazon S3 Bucket.

property.name: Bucket
property.description: The S3 Bucket to interact with

property.name: Object Key
property.description: The S3 Object Key to use. This is analogous to a filename for traditional file systems.

property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.description: The source of the content to be transferred

allowableValue.description: The content of the incoming FlowFile provides the source for transfer
The File Resource Service provides the source for transfer

property.name: File Resource Service
property.description: File Resource Service providing access to the local resource to be transferred

property.name: encryption-service
property.description: Specifies the Encryption Service Controller used to configure requests. PutS3Object: For backward compatibility, this value is ignored when 'Server Side Encryption' is set. FetchS3Object: Only needs to be configured in case of Server-side Customer Key, Client-side KMS and Client-side Customer Key encryptions.

property.name: server-side-encryption
property.description: Specifies the algorithm used for server side encryption.

property.name: Content Type
property.description: Sets the Content-Type HTTP header indicating the type of content stored in the associated object. The value of this header is a standard MIME type. AWS S3 Java client will attempt to determine the correct content type if one hasn't been set yet. Users are responsible for ensuring a suitable content type is set when uploading streams. If no content type is provided and cannot be determined by the filename, the default content type "application/octet-stream" will be used.

property.name: Content Disposition
property.description: Sets the Content-Disposition HTTP header indicating if the content is intended to be displayed inline or should be downloaded. Possible values are 'inline' or 'attachment'. If this property is not specified, object's content-disposition will be set to filename. When 'attachment' is selected, '; filename=' plus object key are automatically appended to form final value 'attachment; filename="filename.jpg"'.

property.name: Cache Control
property.description: Sets the Cache-Control HTTP header indicating the caching directives of the associated object. Multiple directives are comma-separated.

property.name: s3-object-tags-prefix
property.description: Specifies the prefix which would be scanned against the incoming FlowFile's attributes and the matching attribute's name and value would be considered as the outgoing S3 object's Tag name and Tag value respectively. For Ex: If the incoming FlowFile carries the attributes tagS3country, tagS3PII, the tag prefix to be specified would be 'tagS3'

property.name: s3-object-remove-tags-prefix
property.description: If set to 'True', the value provided for 'Object Tags Prefix' will be removed from the attribute(s) and then considered as the Tag name. For ex: If the incoming FlowFile carries the attributes tagS3country, tagS3PII and the prefix is set to 'tagS3' then the corresponding tag values would be 'country' and 'PII'

property.name: Communications Timeout
property.description: The amount of time to wait in order to establish a connection to AWS or receive data from AWS before timing out.

property.description: Amazon Canned ACL for an object, one of: BucketOwnerFullControl, BucketOwnerRead, LogDeliveryWrite, AuthenticatedRead, PublicReadWrite, PublicRead, Private; will be ignored if any other ACL/permission/owner property is specified

property.name: Signer Override
property.description: The AWS S3 library uses Signature Version 4 by default but this property allows you to specify the Version 2 signer to support older S3-compatible services or even to plug in your own custom signer implementation.

property.name: Multipart Threshold
property.description: Specifies the file size threshold for switch from the PutS3Object API to the PutS3MultipartUpload API. Flow files bigger than this limit will be sent using the stateful multipart process. The valid range is 50MB to 5GB.

property.name: Multipart Part Size
property.description: Specifies the part size for use when the PutS3Multipart Upload API is used. Flow files will be broken into chunks of this size for the upload process, but the last part sent can be smaller since it is not padded. The valid range is 50MB to 5GB.

property.name: Multipart Upload AgeOff Interval
property.description: Specifies the interval at which existing multipart uploads in AWS S3 will be evaluated for ageoff. When processor is triggered it will initiate the ageoff evaluation if this interval has been exceeded.

property.name: Multipart Upload Max Age Threshold
property.description: Specifies the maximum age for existing multipart uploads in AWS S3. When the ageoff process occurs, any upload older than this threshold will be aborted.

property.name: s3-temporary-directory-multipart
property.description: Directory in which, for multipart uploads, the processor will locally save the state tracking the upload ID and parts uploaded which must both be provided to complete the upload.

property.name: use-chunked-encoding
property.description: Enables / disables chunked encoding for upload requests. Set it to false only if your endpoint does not support chunked uploading.

property.name: use-path-style-access
property.description: Path-style access can be enforced by setting this property to true. Set it to true if your endpoint does not support virtual-hosted-style requests, only path-style requests.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

dynamicProperty.value: The value of a User-Defined Metadata field to add to the S3 Object

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.sqs.DeleteSQS
extension.description: Deletes a message from an Amazon Simple Queuing Service Queue

property.name: Queue URL
property.description: The URL of the queue delete from

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Receipt Handle
property.description: The identifier that specifies the receipt of the message

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.sqs.GetSQS
extension.description: Fetches messages from an Amazon Simple Queuing Service Queue

property.name: Queue URL
property.description: The URL of the queue to get messages from

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Auto Delete Messages
property.description: Specifies whether the messages should be automatically deleted by the processors once they have been received.

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The maximum number of messages to send in a single network request

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: The Character Set that should be used to encode the textual content of the SQS message

property.name: Visibility Timeout
property.description: The amount of time after a message is received but not deleted that the message is hidden from other consumers

property.name: Receive Message Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time to wait on a long polling receive call. Setting this to a value of 1 second or greater will reduce the number of SQS requests and decrease fetch latency at the cost of a constantly active thread.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

writesAttribute.name: hash.value
writesAttribute.description: The MD5 sum of the message

writesAttribute.name: hash.algorithm
writesAttribute.description: MD5

writesAttribute.name: sqs.message.id
writesAttribute.description: The unique identifier of the SQS message

writesAttribute.name: sqs.receipt.handle
writesAttribute.description: The SQS Receipt Handle that is to be used to delete the message from the queue

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.sqs.PutSQS
extension.description: Publishes a message to an Amazon Simple Queuing Service Queue

property.name: Queue URL
property.description: The URL of the queue to act upon

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Delay
property.description: The amount of time to delay the message before it becomes available to consumers

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: message-group-id
property.description: If using FIFO, the message group to which the FlowFile belongs

property.name: deduplication-message-id
property.description: The token used for deduplication of sent messages

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a Message Attribute to add to the message
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the Message Attribute
dynamicProperty.description: Allows the user to add key/value pairs as Message Attributes by adding a property whose name will become the name of the Message Attribute and value will become the value of the Message Attribute

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.aws.schemaregistry.AmazonGlueSchemaRegistry
extension.description: Provides a Schema Registry that interacts with the AWS Glue Schema Registry so that those Schemas that are stored in the Glue Schema Registry can be used in NiFi. When a Schema is looked up by name by this registry, it will find a Schema in the Glue Schema Registry with their names.

property.name: Schema Registry Name
property.description: The name of the Schema Registry

property.name: Region
property.description: The region of the cloud resources

property.name: Communications Timeout
property.description: Specifies how long to wait to receive data from the Schema Registry before considering the communications a failure

property.name: Cache Size
property.description: Specifies how many Schemas should be cached from the Schema Registry

property.name: Cache Expiration
property.description: Specifies how long a Schema that is cached should remain in the cache. Once this time period elapses, a cached version of a schema will no longer be used, and the service will have to communicate with the Schema Registry again in order to obtain the schema.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.credentials.provider.service.AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService
extension.description: Defines credentials for Amazon Web Services processors. Uses default credentials without configuration. Default credentials support EC2 instance profile/role, default user profile, environment variables, etc. Additional options include access key / secret key pairs, credentials file, named profile, and assume role credentials.

property.name: default-credentials
property.description: If true, uses the Default Credential chain, including EC2 instance profiles or roles, environment variables, default user credentials, etc.

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: profile-name
property.description: The AWS profile name for credentials from the profile configuration file.

property.name: anonymous-credentials
property.description: If true, uses Anonymous credentials

property.name: Assume Role ARN
property.description: The AWS Role ARN for cross account access. This is used in conjunction with Assume Role Session Name and other Assume Role properties.

property.name: Assume Role Session Name
property.description: The AWS Role Session Name for cross account access. This is used in conjunction with Assume Role ARN.

property.name: Session Time
property.description: Session time for role based session (between 900 and 3600 seconds). This is used in conjunction with Assume Role ARN.

property.name: assume-role-external-id
property.description: External ID for cross-account access. This is used in conjunction with Assume Role ARN.

property.name: assume-role-ssl-context-service
property.description: SSL Context Service used when connecting to the STS Endpoint.

property.name: assume-role-proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Proxy configuration for cross-account access, if needed within your environment. This will configure a proxy to request for temporary access keys into another AWS account.

property.name: assume-role-sts-region
property.description: The AWS Security Token Service (STS) region

property.name: assume-role-sts-endpoint
property.description: The default AWS Security Token Service (STS) endpoint ("sts.amazonaws.com") works for all accounts that are not for China (Beijing) region or GovCloud. You only need to set this property to "sts.cn-north-1.amazonaws.com.cn" when you are requesting session credentials for services in China(Beijing) region or to "sts.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com" for GovCloud.

property.name: assume-role-sts-signer-override
property.description: The AWS STS library uses Signature Version 4 by default. This property allows you to plug in your own custom signer implementation.

property.name: custom-signer-class-name
property.description: Fully qualified class name of the custom signer class. The signer must implement com.amazonaws.auth.Signer interface.

property.name: custom-signer-module-location
property.description: Comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories which contain the custom signer's JAR file and its dependencies (if any).

restriction.explanation: The default configuration can read environment variables and system properties for credentials

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.encryption.StandardS3EncryptionService
extension.description: Adds configurable encryption to S3 Put and S3 Fetch operations.

property.name: encryption-strategy
property.description: Strategy to use for S3 data encryption and decryption.

allowableValue.description: Use server-side, KMS key to perform encryption.
Use server-side, customer-supplied key to perform encryption.
Use client-side, KMS key to perform encryption.
Use client-side, customer-supplied key to perform encryption.

property.name: key-id-or-key-material
property.description: For None and Server-side S3: not used. For Server-side KMS and Client-side KMS: the KMS Key ID must be configured. For Server-side Customer Key and Client-side Customer Key: the Key Material must be specified in Base64 encoded form. In case of Server-side Customer Key, the key must be an AES-256 key. In case of Client-side Customer Key, it can be an AES-256, AES-192 or AES-128 key.

property.name: kms-region
property.description: The Region of the AWS Key Management Service. Only used in case of Client-side KMS.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.service.S3FileResourceService
extension.description: Provides an Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3 file resource for other components.

property.name: Bucket
property.description: The S3 Bucket to interact with

property.name: Object Key
property.description: The S3 Object Key to use. This is analogous to a filename for traditional file systems.

property.name: Region
property.description: The AWS Region to connect to.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain AWS credentials provider

useCase.description: Fetch a specific file from S3. The service provides higher performance compared to fetch processors when the data should be moved between different storages without any transformation.
useCase.configuration:
"Bucket" = "${s3.bucket}" "Object Key" = "${filename}"
The "Region" property must be set to denote the S3 region that the Bucket resides in.
The "AWS Credentials Provider Service" property should specify an instance of the AWSCredentialsProviderService in order to provide credentials for accessing the bucket.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.parameter.aws.AwsSecretsManagerParameterProvider
extension.description: Fetches parameters from AWS SecretsManager. Each secret becomes a Parameter group, which can map to a Parameter Context, with key/value pairs in the secret mapping to Parameters in the group.

property.name: secret-listing-strategy
property.description: Strategy to use for listing secrets.

allowableValue.description: Requires a set of secret names to fetch. AWS actions required: GetSecretValue.
Requires a regular expression pattern to match secret names. AWS actions required: ListSecrets and GetSecretValue.

property.name: secret-name-pattern
property.description: A Regular Expression matching on Secret Name that identifies Secrets whose parameters should be fetched. Any secrets whose names do not match this pattern will not be fetched.

property.name: secret-names
property.description: Comma-separated list of secret names to fetch.

property.name: aws-credentials-provider-service
property.description: Service used to obtain an Amazon Web Services Credentials Provider

property.name: aws-ssl-context-service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections
